title: Searching for Faconnable font
content:
Image can be viewed here:   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/FontForums/read.php?f=5&i=8672&t=8672](http://web.archive.org/web/20091012015921/http:/www.myfonts.com/FontForums/read.php?f=5&i=8672&t=8672)   
   
Thanx for answering me by mail.   
   
l.
author: anonymous

comments.content: I thought maybe [Florentine Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20091012015921/http:/www.agfamonotype.co.uk/displayitem.cfm?item=1542113&category=font&BITEMSTR=florentine) or [Embassy](http://web.archive.org/web/20091012015921/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/embassy/embassy/testdrive.html?s=Fa%E7onnable&p=48), but they lack the straightness of your sample. The lc "n" for example is all wrong. Love that cedille, looks like they used a fragment of the "c".
